derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French obscénité or Latin obscaenitas, from obscaenus (see obscene)

entry.def: Obscenity is behaviour, art, or language that is sexual and offends or shocks people.

example.ex: He insisted these photographs were not art but obscenity...
example.tran: 他坚持认为这些照片并非艺术，而是色情。

example.ex: James Joyce justified his use of 'obscenity' on the grounds that it was a natural part of life.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·乔伊斯以“淫秽”是生活的正常部分为由为自己运用“淫秽”进行辩解。

entry.def: An obscenity is a very offensive word or expression.

example.ex: They shouted obscenities at us and smashed bottles on the floor.
example.tran: 他们冲着我们大骂下流话，还把瓶子摔到地上。

entry.tran: 令人憎恶的行为（或事件);道德败坏的行为（或事件）
entry.def: If you refer to an action or event as an obscenity, you disapprove of it very strongly and consider it to be offensive or immoral.

example.ex: It is not the only place experiencing the obscenities of civil war.
example.tran: 饱经内战蹂躏的不止这一个地方。

means.word_mean: 1. the trait of behaving in an obscene manner
2. an offensive or indecent word or phrase

sentences.en: Existing laws on obscenity are to be tightened.

sentences.en: He shouted a stream of obscenities.
sentences.cn: 他大声嚷出一连串的下流话。

sentences.en: His language was full of obscenities.
